title: Central topples Mountain Home, 41-7
text:
Central topples Mountain Home, 41-7 NEAL DENTON, ndenton@baxterbulletin.com 10:12 p.m. CDT October 9, 2015 Buy Photo Mountain Home's Riley Peters rushes against Little Rock Central on Friday night. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) Buy Photo 5 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LITTLE ROCK - Mountain Home will have to wait a while to gain its first victory over Little Rock Central, and it will have to wait at least one more week to gain its first conference victory of the season. 
The Bombers moved the ball well on offense, but gave up three huge plays of 40 yards or more – two going for touchdowns – in the first half alone and fell 41-7 to the Tigers in 7A/6A-East Conference action Friday night at Quigley-Cox Stadium. 
The Bombers – now 1-5 overall and 0-3 in 7A/6A-East Conference play – return to action at 7 p.m. Friday when they host Marion for Homecoming at Bomber Stadium. 
The Bombers' conference losing streak now sits at 25 games. Central will not be in the same conference as Mountain Home next season, leaving the Bombers winless in school history against the Tigers. 
After the Bombers failed to put points on the board with a 62-yard drive on their first possession, Central – which improved to 2-4 overall and 2-1 in league play – struck with 63 yards on one play. Richard Hayes jaunted for the long touchdown run, making it 7-0 with 6:53 left in the first quarter. 
The Bombers put together another long drive, this time gaining points, to even the score. Mountain Home went 69 yards in 12 plays, capped by a 6-yard touchdown pass from Zane Walker to Payton Parker, who made the catch with the defender holding the senior receiver. 
Central began to give the ball to 6-foot-1, 205-pound freshman phenom Oscar Adaway III on its next drive, and Adaway plunged in from 4 yards out with 8:08 left in the half to give the Tigers a 14-7 lead. 
Adaway added another touchdown from 1 yard out on Central's next drive to make it 21-7. 
After the teams traded punts, Mountain Home took over with 41 seconds remaining and threw three incomplete passes, leaving 21 seconds on the clock for Central. 
The big play bit the Bombers again as senior receiver Zachary McFadden made his second catch of 40 yards or more, taking a 73-yard reception to the house after his defender slipped going for the ball. The PAT kick failed, but the Bombers trailed 27-7 going into halftime. 
Adaway added a 9-yard touchdown to open the second half, pushing the lead to four scores. Mountain Home took its first possession of the half and drove 66 yards, but once again failed to put points on the board, driving down to the Central 1-yard line before fumbling the ball away. Buy Photo 
Mountain Home's Hunter Perry hits Central quarterback Caleb Dallimore in the Bombers' 41-7 loss Friday night. (Photo: Neal Denton/The Baxter Bulletin) 
The Tigers took over at their own 6-yard line and drove 94 yards in 12 plays, scoring on a 20-yard keeper by quarterback Caleb Dallimore to make it 41-7 with 10:42 left to play. 
Hayes led Central with 105 yards - all in the first half - on 13 carries in the game, while Adaway added 93 yards on 18 carries. McFadden totaled 116 yards on just two catches for the Tigers. 
Walker was 10 of 19 passing for 68 yards for the Bombers. Parker caught five passes for 24 yards, Drew Strope caught three for 26 yards, and Marcus May and Isaac McKay each caught one pass for 9 yards. 
Cord Smith led Mountain Home's rushing attack with 68 yards on nine carries, while Walker kept 13 times for 54 yards, McKay netted 19 yards on five carries and Riley Peters notched 18 yards on six totes.
